intro: Monopyle mexiae, commonly known as the Mexican monopyle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
